programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jerry Kill enters his second year as New Mexico State's head coach as his Aggies host the Minutemen. Kill earned his first bowl victory, and New Mexico State's fourth in 90 seasons, with a 24-19 win over Bowling Green in the 2022 Quick Lane Bowl.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: All the boxing action.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Circuit Zandvoort in Zandvoort, North Holland, Netherlands.

programme.title: 2023 Little League Baseball World Series
programme.desc: From Williamsport, Pa.

programme.title: High School Football
programme.desc: Action from high school football.

programme.title: SportsCenter at the 2023 US Open
programme.desc: A preview of the U.S. Open with features, interviews and discussion from ESPN's team of tennis commentators.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: McCovey Cove provides the backdrop for a Sunday Night Baseball game between the Braves and Giants. Atlanta won the last three meetings played on Aug. 27 after the franchises split the first 10 engagements on this date. The series started in 1903.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: North Alabama and Mercer face off in an FCS opener. Ty James returns after setting the Mercer single-season record with 1,105 receiving yards last year. His 351 yards in the final game of 2022 established a new FCS and SoCon regular-season mark.

programme.title: Yankees-Dodgers: An Uncivil War
programme.desc: In 1977 and 1978, the New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers squared off in back-to-back World Series. This ESPN Films documentary tells the story of a rivalry filled with colorful characters, seismic controversies and unforgettable moments.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Liberty and Aces square off one final time in the 2023 regular season. Las Vegas evened its record against New York this campaign at 2-2 following an 88-75 win Aug. 17. Chelsea Gray (LVA) notched her second career triple-double in the win.

programme.desc: Action from the paddle sport.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: This Bill Walton documentary covers his days as a high school phenom, his dominance at UCLA, his social activism, an injury-riddled NBA career and to his current job as a controversial basketball commentator.

programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Sieh Bangura and the Bobcats visit the Aztecs. Ohio was a Mid-American Conference finalist last season behind Bangura, who rushed for 1,078 yards and 13 touchdowns. The Bobcats beat the Aztecs 27-0 in the 2018 Frisco Bowl in their only meeting.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Max Fried goes again for the Braves against the Giants. Fried is 2-0 with a 3.74 ERA since returning from the injured list after facing San Francisco on Aug. 20. Luis Matos and Wilmer Flores both went 2-for-3 and homered off Fried in that Giants win.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia faces England at Accor Stadium in Sydney in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. England's only defeat in its 38 matches under Sarina Wiegman was a 2-0 friendly loss versus Australia at Gtech Community Stadium in London on April 11, 2023.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain contests England at Stadium Australia in Sydney in the final of the 2023 World Cup. England defeated Spain on its way to winning EURO 2022. The Lionesses won 2-1 after extra time in the quarterfinals through a winning goal by Georgia Stanway.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Highlights of the FIFA Women's World Cup 2023 held in Australia and New Zealand.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 7 Trojans (9-1, 7-1 Pac-12) and No. 16 Bruins (8-2, 5-2) compete for the Crosstown Cup at the Rose Bowl. USC has won three in a row following a 55-17 rout of Colorado on Nov. 11. UCLA comes off a stunning 34-28 setback at home versus Arizona.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 20 Utes (4-2, 2-1 Pac-12) challenge the No. 7 Trojans (6-0, 4-0). USC moved to 6-0 for the first time since 2006 with a 30-14 triumph versus Washington State on Oct. 8. Utah's four-game win streak was snapped in a loss to then-No. 18 UCLA.

programme.title: Tua
programme.desc: Tua Tagovailoa, a generational football talent, embarks on a journey that began from a childhood family prophecy. Tua attempts to overcome a career-threatening injury and rise as one of the most uniquely skilled players in the history of the game.

programme.title: College Football

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia is up against France at Brisbane Stadium in the quarterfinals of the 2023 World Cup. These teams met in a friendly in Melbourne only six days before the start of the 2023 World Cup. The Matildas won 1-0 courtesy of a goal by Mary Fowler.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain is up against Sweden at Eden Park in Auckland in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. Sweden is unbeaten in all 11 matches against Spain, including a 1-0 victory in Karlskoga in the group stage of EURO 1997 (own goal by Judith Corominas).

programme.desc: Julius (Dr. J) Erving, Dominique Wilkins and Kenny Smith break down the all-time best dunkers, from Michael Jordan and Vince Carter to Zach LaVine.

programme.title: Film Room
programme.desc: To mark the 30th anniversary of the historic 1988 Lakers-Pistons Finals, NBA TV produces a special edition of "Film Room." Hall of Famers Isiah Thomas and James Worthy ('88 Finals MVP), along with John Salley, take viewers through the action.

programme.title: Players Only: Isiah & Magic
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas and Magic Johnson are together to tell the history of their friendship and rivalry.

programme.title: Players Only: Splash Bros & Bad Boys
programme.desc: Golden State's Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson sit down with Isiah Thomas and Joe Dumars for a wide-ranging conversation.

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: The late-'80s Detroit Pistons were known as the "Bad Boys" of the NBA for their style of play. Featuring Isiah Thomas, Bill Laimbeer, Rick Mahorn, Joe Dumars, Dennis Rodman, John Salley and Chuck Daly.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 5 of the 1984 Eastern Conference first-round playoffs. Isiah Thomas' 35 points and 12 assists were not enough to overcome Bernard King's 44 points and 12 rebounds as the Knicks defeat the Pistons 127-123.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 7 of the 1988 Eastern Conference semifinals. Larry Bird out duels Dominique Wilkins with 47 points, 20 of them in the 4th quarter.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever look to earn a season-series split against the Dream in this contest from the Hoosier State. Atlanta gained the advantage with an 82-73 win over Indiana on Aug. 6. Aliyah Boston (IND) matched her career high with 25 points in that loss.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Wings try to sweep the Mercury. Dallas All-Star Arike Ogunbowale is averaging 25 points across three wins versus Phoenix in 2023, and has gone for 30 or more points against the Mercury three times since August 2020, including on June 9.

programme.title: 1993 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Michael Jordan and Charles Barkley put on a show, scoring 42 points each, but Horace Grant pushes the Bulls to victory. From June 11, 1993.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The greatest games in NBA & WNBA history with commentary and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Weekly
programme.desc: The week's top news, storylines, and action in the WNBA.

programme.title: Everything But the Chip: The 2001 76ers
programme.desc: This retrospective takes an in-depth look at one of the most eventful and rewarding seasons in 76ers history. The talented team made it all the way to the NBA Finals, led by 2001 MVP Allen Iverson and 2001 NBA Coach of the Year Larry Brown.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 2 of the 2001 Eastern Conference Semifinals. Allen Iverson scores 54 points to help the 76ers tie the series at one game a piece.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Jamal Murray extends his run with 50 more points, leading the Denver Nuggets to a 119-107 victory over Donovan Mitchell and the Utah Jazz while setting the stage for Game 7 of the Murray-Mitchell scoring duel.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever look to earn a season-series split against the Dream in this contest from the Hoosier State. Atlanta gained the advantage with an 82-73 win over Indiana on Aug. 6. Aliyah Boston (IND) matched her career high with 25 points in that loss.

programme.title: Title IX: 37 Words that Changed America
programme.desc: Candace Parker takes a personal look at the past, present and future of Title IX and the drive for equality in sports. Chronicles and celebrates the societal and cultural impact of Title IX, anchored through the perspective of Parker.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Clyde Drexler scores a game-high 41 points and Hakeem Olajuwon adds 40 to lead Houston to a 123-106 win over visiting Utah in Game 4 of their Western Conference First Round series. From May 5, 1995.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 1 of the 2001 Western Conference semifinals. Shaquille O'Neal dominates the Kings with 44 points, 21 rebounds, and 7 blocked shots. Kobe Bryant adds 29 points.

programme.desc: Alonzo Mourning scores a career-high 50 points. From March 29, 1996.

programme.title: On This Day
programme.desc: Larry Bird's career high 60-point game remains the Celtics' single-game scoring record. Bird went 22-of-36 from the field, including just 1-of-4 from 3-point range, and 15-of-16 from the free-throw line. From March 12, 1985.
